titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John B. Cassady, Indictment
CWG7603

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Metcalfe Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs } Indictment
John B Cassady

The grand jury of Metcalfe County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse John B Cassady of the crime of forgery & altering a receipt committed as follows to wit: The said John B Cassady on the 1st day of December 1865 in the county aforesaid, did unlawfully change & alter a receipt which he had in his possession, executed by Geo. A Clark, dated the 23rd day of August 1865 in this -- said receipt was given for five hundred dollars, and said Cassady then & there erased & changed the word five to the word six by erasing the letters (ve) & inserting the letter (x) & by interlining the character '&' and also the word (eighty) by which, said receipt was changed from a receipt for $500.00 to a receipt for $680.00 which interlineation by said Cassady of said receipt was done by him with the intent to defraud, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Jas. Garnett attorney for the Commonwealth pro. tem.

A copy Att.
R H Young Clk

Commonwealth
vs } Copy Indictment for Forgery.
John B Cassady
